{{cpp/experimental/pmr/title|set_default_resource}}
{{cpp/experimental/lib extensions/pmr/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=experimental/memory_resource|since=libfund_ts|
memory_resource* set_default_resource( memory_resource* r ) noexcept;
}}

If {{c|r}} is not null, sets the default memory resource pointer to {{c|r}}; otherwise, sets the default memory resource pointer to {{tt|new_delete_resource()}}.

The ''default memory resource pointer'' is used by certain facilities when an explicit memory resource is not supplied. The initial default memory resource pointer is the return value of {{tt|new_delete_resource()}}.

This function is thread-safe. Every call to {{tt|set_default_resource}} ''synchronizes with'' (see {{lc|std::memory_order}}) the subsequent {{tt|set_default_resource}} and {{lc|get_default_resource}} calls.

===Return value===
Returns the previous value of the default memory resource pointer.
